message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Minoxidil and hydralazine are vasodilators that can cause reflex tachycardia as the body tries to compensate for the sudden drop in blood pressure. Persistent cough is associated with ACE inhibitors, systemic volume loss with diuretics, and fetal renal toxicity with ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Minoxidil and hydralazine are both vasodilators and can cause reflex tachycardia as the body tries to compensate for the decrease in blood pressure. Persistent cough is a side effect of ACE inhibitors, systemic volume loss is associated with diuretics, and fetal renal toxicity is a side effect of ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Minoxidil and hydralazine are both vasodilators and can cause reflex tachycardia as a side effect. Persistent cough is a side effect of ACE inhibitors, systemic volume loss is a side effect of loop diuretics, and fetal renal toxicity is a side effect of ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Minoxidil and hydralazine are both vasodilators and can lead to reflex tachycardia as a compensatory mechanism. Option A is associated with ACE inhibitors, option B is associated with diuretics, and option C is associated with ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers.

Persistent cough is a side effect of ACE inhibitors, systemic volume loss is a side effect of diuretics, and fetal renal toxicity is a side effect of ACE inhibitors and angiotensin II receptor blockers.

Persistent cough is associated with ACE inhibitors, systemic volume loss with diuretics, and fetal renal toxicity with angiotensin receptor blockers.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hydralazine and minoxidil both are direct-acting vasodilators which can cause reflex tachycardia as a side effect. Persistent cough is a side effect of ACE inhibitors, systemic volume loss is a side effect of diuretics, and fetal renal toxicity is a side effect of angiotensin receptor blockers.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Minoxidil and hydralazine are both vasodilators that can cause Reflex tachycardia as a side effect, due to the activation of the sympathetic nervous system. Persistent cough is a common side effect of ACE inhibitors, and systemic volume loss is associated with diuretics. Fetal renal toxicity is a potential side effect of ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers and is not relevant in this case.

Persistent cough is associated with ACE inhibitors, systemic volume loss with diuretics, and fetal renal toxicity with ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers.
